guide.conclusion: If you have a welder and methods for cutting metal, you will be fine. I personally like using hacksaws and metal files, but an angle grinder and cutoff wheel will work fine.

flags.title: Unpublished
flags.text: This project guide will not appear in search results but can still be viewed by anyone!

flags.title: User-Contributed Project
flags.text: This project guide is not managed by MAKE staff.

guide.introduction:
Tall Bikes, High Bikes, or Double Decker bikes are a very simple and fun bicycle to ride. They ride just like regular bicycles, but you sit almost 6 feet up in the air!

Before you begin, you will want a few things.

1) An abundance of insanity

2) Two bicycles

3) A hacksaw

4) A file

5) A method for welding

6) More insanity
guide.introduction_rendered:
Tall Bikes, High Bikes, or Double Decker bikes are a very simple and fun bicycle to ride. They ride just like regular bicycles, but you sit almost 6 feet up in the air!

Before you begin, you will want a few things.

1) An abundance of insanity

2) Two bicycles

3) A hacksaw

4) A file

5) A method for welding

6) More insanity

Relevant parts
  • Junkyard Bicycle
  • 7 8" schedule 40 ERW steel pipe
  • 1" schedule 40 ERW steel pipe
Tools
  • Abundance of Insanity
  • Assorted screwdrivers and sockets
  • Drill
  • Hacksaw
  • Metal file
  • Welder
guide.summary: Have you ever wondered what it's like ride stilts on wheels? Build your own Tall Bike!
guide.title: My junkyard tall bike
